properties.areaDesc: Santa Fe Metro Area; Middle Rio Grande Valley/Albuquerque Metro Area; Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta Pass
properties.headline: Winter Storm Warning issued February 10 at 5:51PM MST until February 11 at 11:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque NM
properties.description:
...COLDER TEMPERATURES, MODERATE TO HEAVY SNOW, AND WINDY
CONDITIONS TONIGHT THROUGH TUESDAY NIGHT...

.A potent winter storm will overtake New Mexico tonight through
Tuesday night when many northern and central areas of the state
can expect moderate to heavy snowfall and colder temperatures. In
addition, periods of strong and gusty winds will create areas of
blowing snow in central New Mexico focusing through the middle Rio
Grande Valley from Santa Fe to Albuquerque to Socorro. Residents
and travelers through much of northern and central New Mexico can
expect significant travel impacts tonight through Tuesday night.

* WHAT...Moderate to locally heavy snow and blowing snow expected.
Total snow accumulations of 1 to 6 inches. Winds gusting as
high as 40 mph around Santa Fe and Glorieta Pass, and as high as
60 mph below Tijeras Canyon in Albuquerque.

* WHERE...Middle Rio Grande Valley including the Albuquerque Metro
Area, Santa Fe Metro Area, and Glorieta Mesa Including Glorieta
Pass.

* WHEN...From 11 PM this evening to 11 PM MST Tuesday.

* IMPACTS...Plan on slippery road conditions, low visibility and
near white-out conditions in blowing snow. Gusty winds could
bring down tree branches and weakened structures.

* ADDITIONAL DETAILS...Lowest snowfall amounts will be
below canyons, while higher amounts are expected around
northwest Rio Rancho, northern portions of Santa Fe, and areas
just east of Glorieta Pass.
properties.instruction:
If you must travel, keep an extra flashlight, food, and water in
your vehicle in case of an emergency.

The latest road conditions for New Mexico can be obtained by
calling 5 1 1, 1-800-432-4269, or visiting nmroads.com.

NWSheadline: WINTER STORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM 11 PM THIS EVENING TO 11 PM MST TUESDAY
